name: 8.10 "The Art of the Steal" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 8 | 10 Questions

questions.correct: How a dollar can be less than a dollar
options: How to make a Bloody Mary
questions.explanation:
How a dollar can be less than a dollar.

	The guys are talking about how inflation has made a dollar less than a dollar. Woody said he's confused. Norm takes one of Cliff's dollars (who's not in the room at the time) and rips it up showing how as years go by the dollar becomes smaller and smaller. Carla then takes a twenty dollar bill out of Cliff's wallet to show the same principal (but in her case it was mainly to rid Cliff of a greater sum of money).

questions.text: What kind of insurance did Sam have?
questions.explanation:
Hair.

	Sam loved his hair so much he even had it insured. He wanted to get something done with it but he said the insurance company wanted him to get three estimates. When the others questioned him about having hair insurance he said, "Like I"m going to trust my hair with just anyone".

questions.text: Why didn't Rebecca sleep with Robin on the third date?
questions.correct: It had already become an old habit.
options: She wanted to wait until they were married.
There never was a third date.
questions.explanation:
It had already become an old habit.

	Rebecca told Carla she didn't sleep with Robin on the first date because she was out of practice. Then she said she didn't sleep with him on the second date because she thought he respected her for not sleeping with him on the first date. Then Rebecca said, "and by the third date it had already become an old habit."

questions.text: How did Norm explain economics to Woody?
options: Visiting Wall Street in New York
questions.explanation:
Playing Monopoly.

	Woody was the banker since they were trying to explain economics to him. The game Norm had was a mixture of other game pieces because he lost the original pieces throughout the years. The funniest part (in my opinion) was the giant fuzzy dice used to replace the original dice.

questions.text: Who went to Robin's apartment to tell Rebecca that Robin would be 3 hours late?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Carla was going to call Rebecca. Then she told Sam that Rebecca was waiting for Robin butt naked. When Sam heard this he jumped over the bar and rushed out the door.

questions.text: Who said they were an expert on tapeworms?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	They got on the topic of tapeworms when Cliff commented that Robin lead a very exciting life. Norm replied, "Compared to us a tapeworm leads a pretty exciting life" Cliff said when his friends had pets like guinea pigs, he had a tapeworm (or maybe it was a ringworm he stated as an after thought).

questions.text: One of the characters went to tell Rebecca that Robin would be late. What was Rebecca doing when that person arrived at Robin apartment?
questions.correct: Standing naked in front of the TV
questions.explanation:
Standing naked in front of the TV.

	Rebecca was convinced by Carla to surprise Robin in his apartment naked. At first Rebecca was planning to surprise him fully clothed, but Carla told her she was dull.

questions.text: What happened to the two people at Robin's apartment?
questions.explanation:
They were locked in.

	Rebecca thought she pushed the button for the elevator so she could leave. However, she pressed some other button that caused all the doors and windows to be locked so they couldn't get out of the building.

questions.text: What happened when someone tried to turn off the alarm at Robin's apartment?
questions.explanation:
Laser beams appeared.

	Sam said, "This is just great, I come in for a little action and end up in the middle of "Star Wars"." Sam and Rebecca ended up falling to sleep next to each other and when they woke up the beams were gone and the doors and windows all unlocked so they could get out without Robin knowing they were there.

questions.text: Who was putting the bank's money with his own money?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Frasier became very upset at all the lying, sneaking and stealing going on during the game. He asked what the purpose for the game was and Norm said, "we were just trying to teach Woody the principles of economics." Frasier told him that they did a good job in that case.
